Description: Brass incense-burner; spherical, made of two interlocking hemispheres; cast brass decorated with pierced decoration and silver inlays giving the name of the Mamluk Amir (Prince) Badr al-Din Baysari.
Curator's comments: This incense burner was made for an important Mamluk amir, Badr al-Din Baysari who served two sultans (Sultan Baybars 1260-77) and Baraka Khan (1277-9) and died in prison in 1298. The object prominently displays his emblem of a doubleheaded eagle, along with the inscription bearing his name and titles. Coal and incense would have been placed in a container held by gimbals, the smoke from which poured out from the perforated surface.
